com.percussion.design.objectstore
Interface IPSDatabaseComponent

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, IPSComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSAttribute, PSAttributeList, PSDatabaseComponent, PSDatabaseComponentCollection, PSRole, PSSubject
public interface IPSDatabaseComponent
extends IPSComponent

This interface is used by Object store components whose state is saved in a database rather than an XML file. The objects are still XML based. The object uses the PSDatabaseComponentLoader class to perform the much of the work of loading state. The conversion between the database state format and the object's XML format is done using an Rx application. The database component loader will be used to generate xml elements that conform to the model used in IPSComponent.fromXml(org.w3c.dom.Element, com.percussion.design.objectstore.IPSDocument, java.util.ArrayList) for each component type. Saving will be done via generation of database modification directives in XML format which can be sent to another Rx application for batch update processing. This xml format will be accomplished by calling toDatabaseXml(org.w3c.dom.Document, org.w3c.dom.Element, com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation) in each component, which will decide what (if any) modifications to submit to the back end based on that component's state.

          The component may be ignored (it was inserted, then deleted).

          The name of the database component's id attribute
static int DATABASE_COMPONENT_INSERTED

          The component is unchanged since being retrieved by the back end.
static int DATABASE_COMPONENT_UPDATED
          The component has been updated since being retrieved by the back end.

Method Detail

isDelete

boolean isDelete()
Is this database component to be removed from the back end?

Returns:
true if it is, false otherwise.

toDatabaseXml

void toDatabaseXml(Document doc,
                   Element actionRoot,
                   com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation relationContext)
                   throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
Add the action(s) needed to serialize all changes made to this database component to the back end.

Parameters:
doc - The database modification document being created. May not be null.
actionRoot - The root element under which all DBMS actions (updates, inserts, and deletes) are to be added. May not be null or empty.
relationContext - Any relationship context information, so that new relationships may be added to the back end as needed by the components which require them. May be null indicating there is no relationship existing for this component.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is invalid.
PSDatabaseComponentException - if there are errors creating the element.

fromDatabaseXml

void fromDatabaseXml(Element e,
                     com.percussion.design.objectstore.server.PSDatabaseComponentLoader cl,
                     com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation relationContext)
                     throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException,
                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
Instantiate the values in this database component from the xml element returned by the query resource associated with this database component type.

Parameters:
e - The xml element defining this component. May not be null.
cl - The database component loader. May not be null, this is may be used to load any subcomponents.
relationContext - The current relation context, may be null if no relationship exists.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is invalid
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if this component or one of it's sub-components fails to initialize with a supplied element.
PSDatabaseComponentException - if any othererror occurs loading this component from the database

getDatabaseAppQueryDatasetName

String getDatabaseAppQueryDatasetName()
Get the name of the dataset in the system component application which retrieves components of this type.

Returns:
The dataset name. Never null or empty.

getDatabaseComponentIdKeyName

String getDatabaseComponentIdKeyName()
Get the name of the key to use to identify this component from the data retrieved from the system components application

Returns:
The key name. null or empty indicates all components of this type are to be retrieved, or no key is necessary.
